p.s: In the article Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes the Authorauthor is using stylistic devices and specific kinds of language to express his opinion to his readers and convince them.
He uses negative words and frasesphrases to express his clear opinion about unions and their consequences.
In line 7 he uses the words [...] unions are [...] about power and greed to express that unions have changed and they dontdon't do their dedicated task anymore.
He also uses metaphorical language to set a picture in the readersreader's mind.

You can see this in line 11 they have become victims of their own success [...] and what he means by that is, that unions suffer from their own aim to increase the workersworkers' wages and that they now cannot sell their products that much because they have to be more expensive.
Lastly, the author uses personifications to make it easier to imagine something and to put emphasis onto an object.
For example ll. 16-17 Your job is protected by your union and with this he wants to explain why workers don't perform as well as before.
In conclusion, Mr. Pollard uses his stylistic devices to express and explain his opinion and the downsides of unions.
